meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm back with another review that's sure to make you groovy and ready to play some sick games!

Today, I'm diving into the world of indie classics with Braid: Anniversary Edition. Now, I know what you're thinking - "Braid" is an old game, right? Well, let me tell you, it may be a vintage title, but its charm and wit still hold up today.

But before we get started, I've got to give a shoutout to my fellow critics who have already weighed in on this remastered edition. God is a Geek gave Braid: Anniversary Edition a 90, saying it's a reminder of how good the original was. Metro GameCentral also dropped an 80, calling it "cleverly unique" and praising its visuals.

Now that we've got that out of the way, let's get to my review! I'm thrilled to report that Braid: Anniversary Edition is just as enchanting as it was back in the day. The updated graphics are a treat for the eyes (or should I say, the groovy goggles?), and the new levels are a nice bonus.

But what really sets Braid apart is its clever puzzles and brain-teasers. These challenges will have you scratching your head one minute and grinning like a hippie the next. And let's not forget the game's signature "rewind" feature, which allows you to relive those triumphant moments or try again when things don't go quite right.

As with any classic, there might be some who feel that Braid: Anniversary Edition doesn't bring enough new heat to the table. But trust me, this remastered edition is a must-play for anyone looking to experience one of gaming's most groundbreaking titles.

So, what's my verdict? Well, I'll leave that up to you, my fellow gamers. Just remember - when it comes to Braid: Anniversary Edition, the only score that really matters is the fun you have playing it!

Stay groovy, and keep on gaming!
